page.title: 14300 Acre Farm, Prickwillow
page.content: {Mr Stanley Rice}runs the farm which is on the North side of Prickwillow along its whole length up to the River. 'My family have had this farm since my Grandfather was alive. We are a{Peat {Farm} and it varies in depth from 18 inches to 4 feet. We suffer from { {Fen Blows}so we have to put down long straw between Crops such as Onions to prevent loss of soil and crops. Due to the Peat and the shell layer, brought in by the Sea once, we need to add { {Manganese. As the Peat is used and dried out the{ {land drops at about an inch a year.}We are lucky, we have Marine Clay underneath the Peat which is quite fertile. For 1985 we are growing 50 acres of potatoes, 60 of Sugar Beet, 40 of Onions, 20 of Peas, 10 of Barley and 115 acres is Wheat.
